subject: Sexual Health
title: Implantation
description: A quick, practical guide to Implantation.

hook.text: After fertilization, the tiny zygote floats freely for days before finding a place to settle.

buildup.text: The zygote divides repeatedly as it travels down the fallopian tube toward the uterus.

discovery.text: About six days later, the blastocyst burrows into the uterine lining. This is implantation.

twist.text: Implantation fails in roughly half of fertilized eggs. Most women never know conception occurred.

climax.text: Successful implantation triggers hormones that tell the body pregnancy has officially begun.

punchline.text: Half of all conceptions quietly fail at this step.
